alert.note: Alert for Dutchess; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 18 at 7:05PM EDT until July 18 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Dutchess County in east central New York... Southeastern Ulster County in east central New York... * Until 1015 PM EDT. * At 705 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Poughkeepsie, New Paltz, Ellenville, Wallkill, Hyde Park, Milton, Plattekill, Hurley, Wappingers Falls, Highland, Modena, Tillson, High Falls, Marlboro, Fairview, Staatsburg, Port Ewen, Red Oaks Mill, Kerhonkson and Lloyd. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report flooding to the National Weather Service by email at ALB.stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany.
